default.name: Default
default.description: Standard widget generation with balanced complexity

more-components.name: More Components
more-components.description: Encourages use of more UI components and richer layouts
more-components.systemPromptModifier:
**Additional Guidelines - Component Richness:**
- Aim to use 5-8 different UI components per widget
- Include interactive elements like buttons, toggles, and sliders where appropriate
- Use varied layout structures (cards, lists, grids, tabs)
- Include visual elements like icons, badges, and progress indicators
- Create layered, information-dense interfaces that still maintain good UX

apple-style.name: Apple/iOS Style
apple-style.description: Generates widgets with Apple's design aesthetic and iOS conventions
apple-style.systemPromptModifier:
**Additional Guidelines - Apple/iOS Style:**
- Use SF Symbols style icons (simple, rounded, monochromatic)
- Prefer rounded corners (8-16px border radius)
- Use iOS system fonts: San Francisco (SF Pro)
- Follow Apple's Human Interface Guidelines color usage
- Use subtle shadows and depth (avoid heavy drop shadows)
- Prefer light backgrounds with subtle gradients
- Use iOS-style buttons (rounded, filled or outlined)
- Include iOS-style blur effects for overlays
- Use generous whitespace and breathing room
- Follow iOS spacing conventions (8pt grid system)
- Use iOS-style segmented controls and pickers
- Implement iOS-style cards with subtle shadows

android-style.name: Android/Material Design Style
android-style.description: Generates widgets following Material Design principles
android-style.systemPromptModifier:
**Additional Guidelines - Android/Material Design Style:**
- Use Material Design icons (sharp, geometric)
- Follow Material Design 3 principles
- Use elevation and shadows for depth (0dp, 1dp, 2dp, 3dp, 4dp, 6dp, 8dp)
- Implement Material Design color system (primary, secondary, tertiary)
- Use Roboto font family
- Include Material Design buttons (text, outlined, contained, FABs)
- Use Material Design cards with appropriate elevation
- Implement ripple effects on interactive elements
- Use Material Design bottom sheets and dialogs
- Follow 4dp/8dp grid system for spacing
- Use Material Design chips and badges
- Implement dynamic color theming where appropriate
- Use distinctive Material Design motion patterns

minimalist.name: Minimalist
minimalist.description: Clean, simple designs with minimal components
minimalist.systemPromptModifier:
**Additional Guidelines - Minimalist Style:**
- Use 2-4 UI components maximum
- Prefer monochromatic or limited color palettes
- Emphasize whitespace and negative space
- Use simple typography with clear hierarchy
- Avoid decorative elements unless essential
- Focus on core functionality only
- Use subtle, thin borders if needed
- Prefer flat design over shadows and gradients
- Keep layouts simple and linear

data-rich.name: Data-Rich/Dashboard
data-rich.description: Information-dense widgets with charts and metrics
data-rich.systemPromptModifier:
**Additional Guidelines - Data-Rich Style:**
- Include multiple data points and metrics
- Use charts, graphs, and data visualizations
- Implement sparklines and mini charts
- Show trends with arrows and percentage changes
- Use progress bars and gauges
- Include comparison data (vs previous period)
- Use data tables when appropriate
- Implement color coding for data states (positive/negative)
- Use badges and labels for categorization
- Include timestamps and data freshness indicators

playful.name: Playful/Casual
playful.systemPromptModifier:
**Additional Guidelines - Playful Style:**
- Use vibrant, bold color combinations
- Include emoji or playful icons
- Use rounded, friendly shapes
- Implement fun micro-interactions
- Use casual, friendly copy tone
- Include decorative elements and illustrations
- Use gradient backgrounds and colorful accents
- Implement playful animations (bounces, wobbles)
- Use non-standard layouts and creative positioning
